io.werval.api.http

Interface RequestHeader

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Request 

    public interface RequestHeader
    Request header.

    Method, Path, QueryString, Headers and Cookies.

    No Entity.

    Helper methods.

    Parameters are available once bound to a Route, see bind(io.werval.api.routes.ParameterBinders, io.werval.api.routes.Route) and parameters().

    • Method Detail

      • identity

        String identity()
        Returns:
        The HTTP Request ID created by the framework

      • version

        ProtocolVersion version()
        Returns:
        The HTTP Request Protocol Version such as "HTTP/1.0" or "HTTP/1.1".

      • method

        Method method()
        Returns:
        The HTTP Request Method

      • uri

        String uri()
        Returns:
        The HTTP Request URI, URL encoded

      • path

        String path()
        Returns:
        The HTTP Request Path, URL decoded

      • queryString

        QueryString queryString()
        Returns:
        The HTTP Request Query String

      • headers

        Headers headers()
        Returns:
        The HTTP Request Headers

      • cookies

        Cookies cookies()
        Returns:
        The HTTP Request Cookies

      • remoteAddress

        String remoteAddress()
        The HTTP Client Address.

        Default value is the underlying socket client address.

        If the werval.http.headers.x_forwarded_for.enabled configuration property is yes, then the value is computed from the X-Forwarded-For header value. This is the default behaviour.

        If the werval.http.headers.x_forwarded_for.check_proxies configuration property is yes, then X-Forwarded-For value is accepted only if all proxies in the chain are present in the werval.http.headers.x_forwarded_for.trusted_proxies configuration list. This is the default behaviour trusting only 127.0.0.1.

        If the X-Forwarded-For cannot be trusted, Werval will respond with a 400 Bad Request.

        Returns:
        The HTTP Client Address

      • host

        String host()
        The HTTP Host with or without the port, or an empty String.

        HTTP Host header, mandatory since HTTP 1.1.

        Returns:
        The HTTP Host with or without the port, or an empty String

      • port

        int port()
        The HTTP Port.

        Computed from the request URI or HTTP Host header and standard defaults 80/443.

        Returns:
        The HTTP Port

      • domain

        String domain()
        The HTTP Domain.

        Computed from the request URI.

        Returns:
        The HTTP Domain

      • contentType

        String contentType()
        The HTTP Request content type, or and empty String.

        Computed from the Content-Type header, charset removed.

        Returns:
        The HTTP Request content type, or and empty String

      • charset

        String charset()
        The HTTP Request Charset or an empty String.

        Computed from the Content-Type header.

        Returns:
        The HTTP Request Charset or an empty String

      • isKeepAlive

        boolean isKeepAlive()
        Return true if and only if the connection can remain open.

        Honnor Headers.Names.CONNECTION header and then protocol version defaults.

        Returns:
        true if the connection should be kept-alive, false otherwise

      • bind

        RequestHeader bind(ParameterBinders parameterBinders,
                   Route route)
        Bind Route parameters.

        Successive calls to parameters() will return bound parameters.

        Parameters:
        parameterBinders - Parameter binders
        route - Route
        Returns:
        This very RequestHeader

      • parameters

        Map<String,Object> parameters()
        Bound Route parameters.
        Returns:
        Request path and query-string bound parameters, or an empty Map if not bound

      • acceptedLangs

        List<Lang> acceptedLangs()
        Accepted Languages.
        Returns:
        Accepted languages, ordered by the q-values of the Accept-Language header, preferred first

      • preferredLang

        Lang preferredLang()
        Preferred Language.

        Guess the preferred language according to the Accept-Language request header or Application's preferred language, or the language of the default Locale.

        Returns:
        The preferred language

      • acceptedMimeTypes

        List<MediaRange> acceptedMimeTypes()
        Accepted content mime types.
        Returns:
        Accepted content mime types, ordered by the q-values of the Accept header

      • acceptsMimeType

        boolean acceptsMimeType(String mimeType)
        Test if this request accepts the given mime type.
        Parameters:
        mimeType - Mime type
        Returns:
        true if mimeType matches the Accept header, otherwise return false

      • preferredMimeType

        String preferredMimeType(String... mimeTypes)
        Preferred Mime Type.

        Guess the preferred mime types among given mime types according to the Accept request header.

        If the request accepts any mime type and no candidate were given, return *\/*, otherwise return the first candidate.

        If no candidate is accepted, return the preferred mime type according the the Accept request header.

        Parameters:
        mimeTypes - Candidate mime types
        Returns:
        The preferred mime type or the wildcard mimetype, never return null
